intro: Cnestis mannii, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, fragrant, white or pale yellow flowers. Its latex is milky and can be toxic, containing cardiac glycosides. Cnestis mannii is often found in moist, open woodlands and along riverbanks.
